comment._content: Scout leader is William McCrum (d.1932) son of Robert Garmany McCrum who established a linen manufacturing mill near Armagh and built the village of Milford to house the workers for his factory. His son William, pictured here was not a businessman but was more concerned with the well being of the villagers. He captained the local football team as well as being scoutmaster. He is best known in the world of soccer for inventing the Irishman's motion or as it has become known the penalty kick. See Wikipedia en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_McCrum
